decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy using low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. By combining efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending with powerful creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain tempo throughout the match. The deck also includes card selection and draw spells like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to ensure consistency and find key pieces. The mana base is optimized for quick access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of cheap removal like Fatal Push and Dismember, along with powerful counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation. The deck also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent is sufficiently disrupted. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play big threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. It relies on cards like Amulet of Vigor and Explore to accelerate land drops and take advantage of powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The combo aspect of the deck comes from utilizing Scapeshift to search for specific lands and trigger powerful effects, leading to explosive plays. The deck also includes utility lands like Mirrorpool and Tolaria West to provide additional flexibility and options in different situations.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and direct damage spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Guide of Souls, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Static Prison. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for a faster and more aggressive game plan. Players can quickly close out games by using Goblin Bombardment or Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to finish off their opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans and controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It aims to maintain card advantage through efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while using creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck also includes versatile cards like Force of Negation and Counterspell to protect key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game through disruption and efficient threats.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble the Jeskai Ascendancy combo by playing a combination of cheap artifacts and creatures, using Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to dig for combo pieces. Once Jeskai Ascendancy is in play, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and card draw by untapping creatures with its triggered ability. The deck also includes removal spells, card draw, and utility lands to support the combo strategy and protect it from disruption.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with rituals and mana-producing spells, utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to cast powerful spells like Past in Flames and Grapeshot multiple times in a single turn. The deck also includes ways to dig through the deck and find key pieces with cards like Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening. The goal is to chain together spells and generate enough storm count to finish off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot or other burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Basking Broodscale, Blade of the Bloodchief, and Malevolent Rumble to quickly build up a formidable board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes key pieces such as Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up mana production, as well as versatile spells like Ancient Stirrings and Kozilek's Command to control the game. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista provides additional win conditions and utility. Key lands like Cavern of Souls and Boseiju, Who Endures help protect key creatures and spells from disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost burn spells and efficient creatures. It aims to apply pressure early in the game with cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also controlling the opponent's life total with spells like Lightning Bolt and Skullcrack. The deck's strategy revolves around maintaining a fast pace and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Tezzeret the Seeker, Goblin Charbelcher, and Lotus Bloom to quickly generate a win condition without relying on traditional lands for mana. Cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Beyeen Veil help to protect the combo while cards like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation to control the game and ensure the combo goes off successfully.

The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and finish them off before they can stabilize. The deck includes powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, alongside creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at the opponent's life total. The mana base is built to support the aggressive strategy, with a low curve and plenty of red sources to consistently cast spells on curve.
